title: Parris Island: Photographs by William Mares
description:
This exhibition contained more than 50 photographs from a 10-week Marines boot camp training in Parris Island in 1968. After training there himself in 1962, Mares received permission to return and document a 75-man recruit platoon. This was his first
exhibition. It occurred while he was working as a photographer for the Chicago Sun Times. Then Curator of Photography, Hugh Edwards noted that this exhibition was “. . . a lively, unique ensemble, free of present day propaganda of one side or another.”

input: Parris Island: Photographs by William Mares
